intro: Arachnothryx venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan spiderwood, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are a food source for various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
